Define $ x \heartsuit y$ to be $ |x-y|$ for all real numbers $ x$ and $ y$. Which of the following statements is \textbf{not} true?\\
\\
$\textbf{(A)}\ x \heartsuit y = y \heartsuit x \text{ for all } x \text{ and } y$\\
$\textbf{(B)}\ 2(x \heartsuit y) = (2x) \heartsuit (2y) \text{ for all } x \text{ and } y$\\
$\textbf{(C)}\ x \heartsuit 0 = x \text{ for all } x$\\
$\textbf{(D)}\ x \heartsuit x = 0 \text{ for all } x$\\
$\textbf{(E)}\ x \heartsuit y > 0 \text{ if } x \ne y$
